text:
Hey guys, hope everyone had great holidays. I added an environmental variable to the project to hide the api-key on github for added security. Below is the steps on how that's done, along with the api key.

Setting Environment Variables in IntelliJ IDEA:
1. Open Run/Debug Configurations:
    ◦ In the top-right corner, you'll find a dropdown menu next to the green run button. Click on it and select "Edit Configurations..."
2. Select or Create a Run Configuration:
    ◦ In the left pane, you'll see a list of existing run configurations. Select the one you want to modify or create a new one by clicking the "+" icon and choosing the desired configuration type.
3. Set Environment Variables:
    ◦ Look for a section labeled "Environment" or "Configuration" in the configuration window.
    ◦ You will find a table where you can add key-value pairs for environment variables.
    ◦ Click on the "+" icon to add a new environment variable.
4. Enter Variable Name and Value:
    ◦ Enter the name of the environment variable (e.g., `RAPIDAPI_KEY`) in the "Name" column.
    ◦ Enter the corresponding value (e.g., your actual API key) in the "Value" column.
5. Apply and Run/Debug:
    ◦ Click "OK" to apply the changes and close the configuration window.
    ◦ Now, when you run or debug your application using this configuration, it will have access to the specified environment variables.
